content: >>http://www.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/05/30/gates.north.korea/index.html<< quote: "We will not stand idly by as North Korea builds the capability to wreak destruction on any target in the region -- or on us," said Gates, speaking at the International Institute for Strategic Studies in Singapore. "Our goal is complete and verifiable denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, and we will not accept North Korea as a nuclear weapons state," he said. Using this type of language too me signals that China is on-board the US Program. Beijing does not want to see a Nuclear Armed South Korea, Japan or Taiwan.... Whats a worst option for Beijing? 1.) Nuclear Armed South Korea, Japan, Taiwan, ruining their goals for regional domination.. or 2.) Possible regime collpse of North Korea and a wave of refugees into China? China can deal with the refugee problem, but getting rid of those weapons will not happen once it does....
quote: "We will not stand idly by as North Korea builds the capability to wreak destruction on any target in the region -- or on us," said Gates, speaking at the International Institute for Strategic Studies in Singapore. "Our goal is complete and verifiable denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula, and we will not accept North Korea as a nuclear weapons state," he said.

China can deal with the refugee problem, but getting rid of those weapons will not happen once it does....
title: Secretary Gates: Nuclear Armed North Korea Unacceptable

content: Personally I think...it seems simple enough if you are correct... Any missile fired from NK would be considered as fired from China towards Japan or SK... Bring it on... content: quote: Originally posted by Duster6: Are we sure Kim soon moon Park even has WMD? I know he shoots off a missile every week it seems but has any mushroom clouds every been seen? We don't have a very good track record when it comes to determining where WMD's are located. Sometrhing tells me the sensors they used detect radiation from a nuclear explosion. I think that would be evidence, correct? Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
